# Ela "Ela" or "ELA" has multiple meanings across different languages, cultures, and contexts. ## Names and Linguistic Usage ### As a Name - **Ela** is used as a [given name](/article/en/Given_name) and [surname](/article/en/Surname) - **Ela** is a name for the [Hebrew](/article/en/Hebrew_language) god [Yahweh](/article/en/Yahweh). For example, in the [Book of Ezra](/article/en/Book_of_Ezra) (5:1), "Ela Yisrael" means "God of Israel" - **King Elah of Israel** (also referred to as Ela), mentioned in the [Bible](/article/en/Bible), ruled the [Kingdom of Israel](/article/en/Kingdom_of_Israel) from approximately 915-913 BCE ### In Language - **Ela** is the feminine third-person personal pronoun (she) in [Portuguese](/article/en/Portuguese_language) - **Eḷa**, or **Elu**, is considered an ancestor to the [Sinhalese](/article/en/Sinhalese_language) and [Dhivehi](/article/en/Dhivehi_language) languages - **Ela** is a note name in music theory, see [Guidonian hand](/article/en/Guidonian_hand) ## Organizations and Entities ### Trade Unions and Political Organizations - **[Basque Workers' Solidarity](/article/en/Basque_Workers_Solidarity)** (Basque: Euskal Langileen Alkartasuna, ELA), a trade union - **[Revolutionary People's Struggle](/article/en/Revolutionary_People's_Struggle)** (Greek: Επαναστατικός Λαϊκός Αγώνας, ΕΛΑ), a Greek left-wing terrorist organization - **[Greek People's Liberation Army](/article/en/Greek_People's_Liberation_Army)** (Greek: Ελληνικός Λαϊκός Απελευθερωτικός Στρατός, ΕΛΑΣ; Ellinikós Laïkós Apeleftherotikós Stratós) - **[Earth Liberation Army](/article/en/Earth_Liberation_Army)** - **[European Lift Association](/article/en/European_Lift_Association)**, a trade association - **[European Laser Association](/article/en/European_Laser_Association)** - **[European Labour Authority](/article/en/European_Labour_Authority)** - **[European Logistics Association](/article/en/European_Logistics_Association)** - **[English Lacrosse Association](/article/en/English_Lacrosse_Association)** ### Companies - **[ELA Aviación](/article/en/ELA_Aviación)**, a Spanish aircraft manufacturer - **[Equatorial Launch Australia](/article/en/Equatorial_Launch_Australia)**, owner-operator of [Arnhem Space Centre](/article/en/Arnhem_Space_Centre) in northern Australia - **ELA**, the name of [Kaela Kimura's](/article/en/Kaela_Kimura) private label established within JVC Kenwood Victor Entertainment's Colourful Records ## Places ### Geographic Locations - **[East Los Angeles](/article/en/East_Los_Angeles)**, California, United States - **[Eastside Los Angeles](/article/en/Eastside_Los_Angeles)**, United States - **[Ela](/article/en/Konta)** (woreda), now Konta, Ethiopia - **[Ela, North Carolina](/article/en/Ela,_North_Carolina)**, United States - **[Ela Beach](/article/en/Ela_Beach)**, in Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea - **[Ela River](/article/en/Ela_River)**, in New Hampshire, United States - **[Ela Township](/article/en/Ela_Township,_Lake_County,_Illinois)**, Lake County, Illinois, United States - **[Parc Ela](/article/en/Parc_Ela)**, a Swiss nature park - **[Piz Ela](/article/en/Piz_Ela)**, a mountain in the Swiss park - **[Valley of Ela](/article/en/Valley_of_Elah)** (Hebrew: עמק האלה‎; Emek HaElah; also known as Valley of Elah or Valley of Terebinth), where according to the Bible the battle between [David and Goliath](/article/en/David_and_Goliath) took place - **Ela**, a 10th century BCE fortress, located in the Israeli archaeological site of [Khirbet Qeiyafa](/article/en/Khirbet_Qeiyafa), believed to belong to the ancient Kingdom of Judah ### Facilities and Infrastructure - **[ELA-1](/article/en/ELA-1)** (Ensemble de Lancement Ariane), a rocket launch pad in French Guiana - **[Experimental Lakes Area](/article/en/Experimental_Lakes_Area)**, in northwestern Ontario, Canada - **[Nay Pyi Taw International Airport](/article/en/Nay_Pyi_Taw_International_Airport)**, formerly Ela Airport, in Myanmar ## Science and Medicine ### Medical - **[Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis](/article/en/Amyotrophic_lateral_sclerosis)** (ALS), a fatal neurological disease, known as ELA in Spanish and Portuguese - **[Eleostearic acid](/article/en/Eleostearic_acid)**, abbreviated as ELA ### Technical and Scientific - **[Elative case](/article/en/Elative_case)**, in grammar - **[Electronic Journal of Linear Algebra](/article/en/Electronic_Journal_of_Linear_Algebra)** - **[Emergency Liquidity Assistance](/article/en/Emergency_Liquidity_Assistance)** - **[English language arts](/article/en/English_language_arts)**, an educational field - **[Equilibrium line altitude](/article/en/Equilibrium_line_altitude)**, in glaciology - **[Error level analysis](/article/en/Error_level_analysis)**, the analysis of compression artifacts in digital data - **[Encryption Licensing Arrangements](/article/en/Encryption_Licensing_Arrangements)** ## Media and Entertainment ### Music - **E.L.A.** (album), by [Elastinen](/article/en/Elastinen) - **"[Ela](/article/en/Ela_(Barrice_song))"** (Barrice song) - **[Ela](/article/en/Ela_(Peggy_Zina_album))** (Peggy Zina album) - **"[Ela](/article/en/Ela_(Andromache_song))"** (Andromache song) - **[She](/article/en/She_(Elis_Regina_album))** (album), by Elis Regina (translated as "Ela" in Portuguese) ### Film and Literature - **[In the Valley of Elah](/article/en/In_the_Valley_of_Elah)**, a 2007 American film directed by Paul Haggis - **[Elle](/article/en/Elle_(film))** (film), with Isabelle Huppert, distributed in Portugal as "She" (Ela) - **[Elles](/article/en/Elles_(film))**, film with Miou Miou and Carmen Maura, titled in Portugal as "They" (Elas) - **[She](/article/en/She_(1965_film))** (1965 film), with Ursula Andress, shown in Brazil as "Ela" - **[Her](/article/en/Her_(film))**, film with Joaquin Phoenix renamed in Brazil as "Ela" - **Ela**, characters in the novels of the [Ender's Game](/article/en/Ender's_Game_(novel_series)) saga, by [Orson Scott Card](/article/en/Orson_Scott_Card) ### People - **[Ela Darling](/article/en/Ela_Darling)**, an American pornographic actress and co-founder of the virtual reality company VRTube.xxx ## Sports and Recreation - **[Ela Nguema](/article/en/Ela_Nguema)**, a Guinean football club from Malabo ## Other Uses - **ELA** ([autonomous local entity](/article/en/Autonomous_local_entity)) - **ELA** (Commonwealth) of [Puerto Rico](/article/en/Puerto_Rico) (Estado Libre Asociado) - **[Early Lunar Access](/article/en/Early_Lunar_Access)** (ELA) - **Ela** (moth), a synonym of the moth genus [Euproctis](/article/en/Euproctis) - **ELA** (Studies in Applied Linguistics), a journal ## See also - [Elah](/article/en/Elah_(disambiguation)) (disambiguation) - [Elá](/article/en/Elá_(disambiguation)) (disambiguation)
